glsa.title: Apache mod_authnz_external: SQL injection
glsa.synopsis: An input sanitation flaw in mod_authnz_external allows remote attacker to conduct SQL injection.

background.p: mod_authnz_external is a tool for creating custom authentication backends for HTTP basic authentication.

description.p: mysql/mysql-auth.pl in mod_authnz_external does not properly sanitize input before using it in an SQL query.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject arbitrary SQL statements by using a specially crafted username for HTTP authentication on a site using mod_authnz_external.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
